1.text: Then Jesus was carried up into the wilderness by the Spirit to be tempted of the devil:

2.text: and having fasted forty days and forty nights, afterwards he hungered.

3.text: And the tempter coming up to him said, If thou be Son of God, speak, that these stones may become loaves of bread.

4.text: But he answering said, It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word which goes out through God’s mouth.

5.text: Then the devil takes him to the holy city, and sets him upon the edge of the temple,

6.text: and says to him, If thou be Son of God cast thyself down; for it is written, He shall give charge to his angels concerning thee, and on [their] hands shall they bear thee, lest in anywise thou strike thy foot against a stone.

7.text: Jesus said to him, It is again written, Thou shalt not tempt [the] Lord thy God.

8.text: Again the devil takes him to a very high mountain, and shews him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory,

9.text: and says to him, All these things will I give thee if, falling down, thou wilt do me homage.

10.text: Then says Jesus to him, Get thee away, Satan, for it is written, Thou shalt do homage to [the] Lord thy God, and him alone shalt thou serve.

11.text: Then the devil leaves him, and behold, angels came and ministered to him.

12.text: But having heard that John was delivered up, he departed into Galilee:

13.text: and having left Nazareth, he went and dwelt at Capernaum, which is on the sea-side in the borders of Zabulon and Nepthalim,

14.text: that that might be fulfilled which was spoken through Esaias the prophet, saying,

15.text: Land of Zabulon and land of Nepthalim, way of [the] sea beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the nations:

16.text: —the people sitting in darkness has seen a great light, and to those sitting in [the] country and shadow of death, to them has light sprung up.

17.text: From that time began Jesus to preach and to say, Repent, for the kingdom of the heavens has drawn nigh.

18.text: And walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers, Simon called Peter, and Andrew his brother, casting a net into the sea, for they were fishers;

19.text: and he says to them, Come after me, and I will make you fishers of men.

20.text: And they, having left their trawl-nets, immediately followed him.

21.text: And going on thence he saw other two brothers, James the [son] of Zebedee and John his brother, in the ship with Zebedee their father, mending their trawl-nets, and he called them;

22.text: and they, having left the ship and their father, immediately followed him.

23.text: And [Jesus] went round the whole [of] Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the glad tidings of the kingdom, and healing every disease and every bodily weakness among the people.

24.text: And his fame went out into the whole [of] Syria, and they brought to him all that were ill, suffering under various diseases and pains, and those possessed by demons, and lunatics, and paralytics; and he healed them.

25.text: And great crowds followed him from Galilee, and Decapolis, and Jerusalem, and Judaea, and beyond the Jordan.
